Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Barbara A Cote, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 1/28/24, staff member was observed into youth's body, then
grabbing youth and pulling them to the ground Staff member got
on top of the youth's upper body. Youth is being taken to the
emergency department due to complaints of shoulder and back
pain.
Investigation Complainant was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker and
provided no new information.
Clinical Services Manager and Vice President of Operation
were interviewed face to face at the facility on January 31,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. VP of Operation
reported Staff 4 was notified of suspension on 1/29/2024 and told
to be at the facility today at 11am. VP of Operation stated Staff 4
is aware the incident is under investigation by outside
organizations but is not aware of the details or what incident.
Clinical Services Manager reported the incident report Staff 4
wrote does not match the video footage. Clinical Services
Manager stated Youth A has autism and it is a trigger for him
when people are close to him or touch him.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
2

A entered the room and stated he was not talking about the
incident. An attempt to interview Youth A was made prior to
DHHS Worker and myself leaving and Youth A refused to talk. An
attempt to interview Youth A on February 5, 2024, in collaboration
with DHHS Worker, proved unsuccessful as Youth A again
refused to talk.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
B described Youth A being bumped to the ground by Staff 4 and
Staff 4 attempting to restrain Youth A. Youth B reported Youth A
pushed Staff 4 and tried to swing at Staff 4. Youth B stated Staff 4
pushed Youth A, he dropped his weight so Staff 4 could not
restrain Youth A. Youth B denied Staff 4 having her hands on
Youth A. Youth B reported Youth C also witnessed the incident.
Youth B denied ever seeing Staff 4 interact with a youth like that in
the past.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Youth
C described Youth A swing at Staff 4, Staff 4 “push him [Youth A]
a little bit and maybe hitting the wall,” then Youth A tripped on a
colored pencil and fell to the ground. Youth C stated Youth A
grabbed Staff 4’s arm and she fell on top of Youth A. Youth C
reported Staff 1 yelled at Staff 4 to get off Youth A but Staff 4’s
arm was stuck under Youth A. Youth C stated Staff 4 got off
Youth A and that was pretty much all that happened. Youth C
denied ever seeing Staff 4 interact with a youth like that in the
past. Youth C reported feeling safe at the facility and not having
any concerns with staff.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 1 described
Staff 4 being outside the facility with Youth B who had been
escalated from a previous incident but was ready to come back
inside the facility. Staff 1 stated she was in the living room with
Youth A who was playing with a ball and still talking about the
incident with Youth B. Staff 1 reported Staff 4 entered the facility
and started telling Youth A he needed to separate himself from the
area and started walking closer to Youth A. Staff 1 stated it is
known that touch is a trigger for Youth A. Staff 1 described Staff 4
walking closer to Youth A, Youth A asking for space and then Staff
4 bumping her shoulder into Youth A. Staff 1 stated Staff 4
pushed Youth A and he stumbled toward the wall. Staff 1 reported
Youth A pushed Staff 4 to create space for himself, there was a
struggle where Staff 4 grabbed Youth A’s shirt/arm and Youth A
3

fell to the floor. Staff 1 described the struggle as Youth A moving
away from Staff 4 and Staff 4 trying to grab Youth A while moving
toward Youth A. Staff 1 reported she believed Staff 4 said
something to Youth A but does not recall what was said. Staff 1
stated Youth A was on the floor laying on his back, and Staff 4
had her upper body over Youth A’s upper body, holding his arms
preventing Youth A from getting up. Staff 1 reported it was not a
restraint or any technique staff are taught to use. Staff 1 stated
she told Staff 4 to “get off him [Youth A] and this is not how we
handle this.” Staff 1 reported Staff 4 yelled at her to stop telling her
how to do her job. Staff 1 described Staff 4 releasing Youth A’s
arms, stand up, then Youth A got up and walked out the door of
the facility with Staff 2 following behind. Staff 1 reported Staff 4
moved to follow Youth A but turned around in the doorway and
told Staff 1 to not correct her and let her do her job. Staff 1 stated
Staff 4 proceeded to go outside with Youth A and Staff 2 and walk
toward the parking lot. Staff 1 reported immediately after the
incident she contacted the on-call supervisor to report what
happened and sent an email to the management team with her
concerns documenting the incident. Staff 1 reported having
earlier concerns with comments Staff 4 had made to youth in the
past and shared those concerns with Clinical Services Manager.
Staff 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 2 described
responding to an out of bounds call for Youth B and standing
outside with Staff 4 and Youth B. Staff 2 reported Staff 4 entered
the facility and Staff 2 stayed outside with Youth B. Staff 2 stated
when he entered the facility, he saw Youth A bump into Staff 4,
Staff 4 standing her ground then maybe try to initiate a hold. Staff
2 described Staff 4’s body pushed Youth A, Youth A fall near the
corner of the mud room and Staff 4 fell on top of Youth A. Staff 2
stated Youth A fell to the ground on his back and Staff 4 fell on
Youth A’s chest. Staff 2 denied this being an approved or taught
behavior management technique. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 told
Staff 4 to get off Youth A and Staff 4 told Staff 1 to not tell her how
to do her job. Staff 2 stated Staff 4 stood up, then Youth A got up
and walked out of the facility, so Staff 2 followed Youth A. Staff 2
reported youth bumping into staff is not a reason to restrain youth,
so Staff 2 was unsure what Staff 4 was trying to do. Staff 2
denied ever seeing Staff 4 interact with a youth like that in the
past.
Staff 3 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 3 reported
not seeing much of the incident because she was focused on
4

Youth B who had picked up keys that fell out of Staff 4’s pocket.
Staff 3 described turning and seeing Youth A and Staff 4 on the
floor and not knowing what caused them to fall. Staff 3 stated it
looked like a wrestling match with Youth A laying on his back,
Staff 4 laying over Youth A and holding Youth A’s arms to the
floor. Staff 3 reported she was not sure if Staff 4 was trying to
restrain Youth A but there is no restraint technique how Staff 4
was holding Youth A. Staff 3 stated Staff 1 was telling Staff 4 to
“let go” and “get off him.” Staff 3 reported Staff 4 yelled at Staff 1
saying “don’t tell me how to do my job.” Staff 3 described Staff 4
releasing Youth A, stand up and then Youth A stand up and walk
outside. Staff 3 stated Staff 2 followed Youth A outside and Staff
4 was yelling again at Staff 1. Staff 3 reported she could not recall
what Staff 4 was saying to Staff 1. Staff 3 stated she has not
witnessed Staff 4 ever act like this towards a youth in the past.
Staff 3 reported she has had concerns with comments Staff 4 has
made towards youth and talked to Supervisor about her concerns.
Staff 4 was interviewed face to face at the facility on January
31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Staff 4 described
being outside with Youth B who was getting ready to enter the
facility after being escalated with Youth A. Staff 4 reported she
had asked for Youth A to go to his room prior to Youth B entering
the facility so there would not be an issue again between Youth A
and Youth B. Staff 4 stated she was looking in through the
window, saw Youth A still in the common area throwing a ball in
the air so Staff 4 yelled to Staff 1 to have Youth A go to his room.
Staff 4 reported she entered the facility and said to Youth A, “I told
you to go to your room.” Staff 4 stated Youth A went to go around
her, shoved into her, Staff 4 used proximity and Youth A said he
was going to swing on her. Staff 4 reported Youth A and she fell
to the ground, Youth A was swinging his arms at her, she was
able to get off Youth A and get to her knees while she tried to hold
Youth A’s arms. Staff 4 stated she does not know how they fell to
the floor, but Youth A told Staff 4 he slipped on some colored
pencils that were on the floor. Staff 4 reported not trying to
restrain Youth A when on the floor but trying to protect herself.
Staff 4 stated there is not any approved restraint technique having
a youth on the ground laying on their back. Staff 4 reported it was
not her intension to lay on Youth A. Staff 4 reported Staff 1 yelled
at Staff 4 to get off Youth A. Staff 4 at first denied that she said
anything back to Staff 1 but when asked if she told Staff 1 to not
tell her how to do her job, Staff 4 said, “I absolutely told her that.”
Staff 4 reported Staff 1 “did not bother to help.” Staff 4 stated
before walking out the door she told Staff 1 she escalated the
situation. Staff 4 denied pushing Youth A and reported she could
5

not recall every detail of the situation. Staff 4 was shown the
video of the incident and stated in her head she does not
remember pushing Youth A. Staff 4 stated her interactions were
not appropriate Aegis techniques or behavior management/de-
escalation interventions.
Therapist was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 31, 2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker.
Therapist reported Youth A’s needs are being met by the facility.
Therapist denied Youth A expressing any concerns regarding any
staff at the facility.
DHHS Worker has findings in the investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of January 28, 2024, was reviewed January 31,
2024, in collaboration with DHHS Worker. Video shows Youth A
walking back and forth in the common area throwing a ball into the
air. Staff 4 is seen walking into the house and follow behind Youth
A walking back and forth. Staff 4 walks into Youth A bumping her
shoulder into him, Youth A appears to push Staff 4 away from him,
then turns to walk in the other direction away from Staff 4. Youth
A is seen moving his arm up with Staff 4 holding onto his wrist.
Youth A moves his arm to get free of Staff 4 and continues to walk
away from Staff 4 toward the door of the facility. Video shows
Staff 4 use two hands to push Youth A causing Youth A to
stumble into the door frame and where Staff 1 is standing. Youth
A is then seen attempting to get to the door, Staff 4 gets in front of
Youth A and grabs him with both hands. It appears Youth A is
trying to push past Staff 4, while Staff 4 is attempting to pull Youth
A away from the door. Youth A falls to the floor, while Staff 4 is
holding Youth A’s wrist, and he is struggling to free his wrist. The
video does not show Staff 4 falling to the floor, it appears she is in
control of her body and lowers herself to the floor holding Youth
A’s wrists and hovering over his upper body. Video shows Staff 1
saying something to Staff 4 but there is no audio on the video.
Staff 4 releases Youth A, Staff 4 stands up then Youth A stands
up and walks out the facility door. Staff 4 is seen turning toward
Staff 1 and appearing to say something while moving her hands.
Staff 4 is then seen walking out the door.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Incident Report for Youth A completed by
Staff 4; report does not accurately reflect what the video or
information from interviews with Staff 1, Staff 2, or Staff 3.
Incident report completed by Staff 4 describes Youth A
6

attempting to escape, actively shoving Staff 4, and
grabbing Staff 4’s jacket as Youth A slipped on colored
pencils and fell to the floor.
• Email from Staff 1 dated 1/28/24 detailing concerns with
Staff 4’s behavior and following proper protocol with
physical intervention. The email was an accurate account
detailing what the video footage showed.
• Eagle Village Health Care Visit for Youth A dated 1/29/24.
Youth A was taken to the emergency department due to
expressing concern with pain in his hips and lower back.
• After Visit Summary from Corewell Health Reed City
Hospital for Youth A dated 1/29/24. Youth A was
diagnosed with bilateral hip pain and given instructions to
use Tylenol and Motrin as needed.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Disciplinary Action Form dated
1/29/24 for Staff 4 placing her on suspension for allegations
from an incident that happened on 1/28/24. There were
disciplinary action forms for Staff 4 but only one involved
Staff 4 using inappropriate language around youth and
being involved in an unwarranted hold. Staff 4 completed
Aegis Verbal Refresher training on 1/03/24 and Aegis
Physical Refresher training on 11/08/23.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 4 pushed Youth A,
grabbed him, pulled him to the ground then held him to the
ground. The facility completed an internal investigation and
terminated Staff 4 on January 31, 2024.
Technical Assistance:
It was recommended the facility talk with staff about physically
intervening to stop staff when inappropriate physical contact is
occurring. The incident did not last long, and Staff 1 is seen
verbally redirecting Staff 4 but training for staff on the need to
perhaps have to physically redirect a co-worker and react sooner
in a situation is recommended.
Conclusion Violation Established
7

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
